sn45.7:1.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and said to him:
sn45.7:2.1: “Sir, they speak of ‘the removal of greed, hate, and delusion’.
sn45.7:2.2: What is this a term for?”
sn45.7:2.4: “Mendicant, the removal of greed, hate, and delusion is a term for the natural principle of extinguishment.
sn45.7:2.6: It’s used to speak of the ending of defilements.”
sn45.7:3.1: When he said this, the mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn45.7:3.3: What is the deathless? And what is the path that leads to the deathless?”
sn45.7:3.4: “The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.7:3.6: The path that leads to the deathless is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn45.7:3.7: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.”
